entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character in the story, introduced as a boy who is about to start at Hogwarts. He is described as being quiet and having a conversation with Madam Malkin.

entities.name: madam malkin
entities.description: Madam Malkin is an old woman who runs a shop selling robes for wizards and witches. She is mentioned as saying 'That's you done, my dear' to Harry.

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is a gamekeeper at Hogwarts and a friend of Harry's. He buys ice-cream for Harry and asks him what's wrong when he seems quiet.

entities.name: hogwarts
entities.description: Hogwarts is a school for wizards and witches where Harry will be starting soon. It is mentioned as being an exclusive place that only accepts certain families.

entities.name: diagon alley
entities.description: Diagon Alley is a street in London where wizards and witches shop for supplies. It is mentioned as the location of Madam Malkin's shop.

relationships.description: Harry will be attending Hogwarts, a school for wizards and witches. This is mentioned as he is about to start at the school.
Madam Malkin serves Harry by helping him with his robes, saying 'That's you done, my dear' to him.
Hagrid is a friend of Harry's and buys ice-cream for him. He also asks Harry what's wrong when he seems quiet.
